author: Stephanie Lai, Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said he intended to send letters to trading partners in the next one to two weeks setting unilateral tariff rates, ahead of a July 9 deadline to reimpose higher duties on dozens of economies.
title: Trump Says Again He’ll Set Unilateral Tariffs in Two Weeks

author: Ramsey Al-Rikabi
description: The World Bank’s board lifted its ban on supporting nuclear power, and is discussing whether to fund natural exploration and production, as it seeks ways to bolster access to electricity to realize its core development goals.
title: World Bank Lifts Ban on Nuclear Power, Considers Upstream Gas

author: Stephanie Lai, Jorge Valero, Brian Platt
description: Group of Seven nations won’t try to reach consensus on a joint communique at next week’s leaders summit in Canada, people familiar with the matter said, an acknowledgment of the wide gulf that separates the US from the other members on Ukraine, climate change and other issues.
title: Group of Seven Tries to Avoid Trump Conflict by Scrapping Joint Communique

author: Anika Arora Seth
description: A former Columbia University graduate who has been fighting deportation over his participation in pro-Palestinian protests was ordered released from an Immigration and Customs Enforcement facility by a federal judge.
title: Ex-Columbia Student Khalil Ordered Released From ICE Custody

author: Andreina Itriago
description: President Gustavo Petro signed a decree for a labor-rights referendum as Colombia grapples with a surge in armed attacks.
title: Colombia’s Petro Moves Ahead With Labor Referendum Despite Rising Violence

author: Steven T. Dennis, Alex Harris
description: Texas Senator Ted Cruz pitched Republican senators Wednesday on ending the Federal Reserve’s authority to pay interest to banks, claiming it would save $1.1 trillion over a decade, with members of the party’s conservative flank lauding the idea.
title: Cruz Pitches $1.1 Trillion Cut to Fed Bank Payments for Trump Tax Bill

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The Pentagon has launched a review of the Biden-era Aukus pact to develop nuclear-powered submarines with Australia and the UK, as the Trump administration looks to shift the burden for collective defense to allies and make sure the US has enough warships of its own.
title: Pentagon Mulls Scrapping Aukus Agreement With Australia and UK

author: Andrew Rosati, Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazil’s Supreme Court formed a majority in favor of further regulating social media companies, the latest effort by authorities to hold tech giants accountable for illegal content posted on their platforms.
title: Social Media Firms Accountable for Posts, Brazil Judges Conclude

author: Eliyahu Kamisher, John Gittelsohn
description: After months of courting Republicans, the Democratic governor now warns Trump is undermining democracy with the military deployment in Los Angeles.
title: LA Protests Pit Gavin Newsom as Antagonist Against Donald Trump

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Gerry Smith
description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. announced on X the names of eight new members of an expert panel that advises the federal government on vaccine policy.
title: RFK Jr. Picks Eight New Members of CDC Vaccine Panel

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: On this episode of Trumponomics, we discuss the status of Washington’s trade war negotiations with Beijing, and why Xi Jinping still has the upper hand.
title: Why China Can Afford to Wait for a Deal, and the US Can’t

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the politics of the immigration protests. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: As Protests Spread, Both Parties Gird for Confrontation

author: Erik Larson, Josh Wingrove, Shawn Donnan, Laura Curtis
description: The fate of President Donald Trump’s trade war lies in the hands of the courts as a legal battle plays out over his use of emergency powers to impose tariffs.
title: What to Know About the Legal Battle Over Trump’s Tariffs

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: Solving the global fertility crisis would require creating conditions that support parenting instead of pushing economic incentives, according to a new UN report.
title: Global Fertility Crisis Can't Be Solved With Financial Perks, UN Report Says

author: Mark Chediak
description: The Trump administration’s plan to repeal power-plant pollution mandates will make it easier and cheaper for utilities to build new fossil fuel-fired plants, while stalling investment in clean energy.
title: Trump’s Repeal of Pollution Rules Paves Way for New Dirty Plants

author: Eliyahu Kamisher, Isabela Fleischmann, Maxwell Adler
description: Protests over immigration raids that began in Los Angeles continued to spread across the US as President Donald Trump escalated his crackdown by unleashing new federal powers.
title: Downtown LA Set for Second Night of Curfew as Trump Crackdown Expands

author: Anders Melin, Nguyen Dieu Tu Uyen, Francesca Stevens
description: An economic boom lifted the country of 100 million out of poverty. Then came the Trump rug-pull.
title: US Tariffs Threaten to Derail Vietnam’s Historic Industrial Boom

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: The Trump administration is reducing embassy staff in Iraq and allowing military service-members’ families to leave the Middle East in response to ongoing security concerns.
title: US Orders Partial Evacuation of Iraq Embassy as Tensions Rise

author: Erik Wasson
description: Republican senators are considering placing a $30,000 cap on the state and local tax deduction as a compromise between current law and the more generous limit in House’s version of President Donald Trump’s tax bill, a key GOP negotiator said.
title: Republican Senators Consider $30,000 SALT Cap in Trump Tax Bill

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: The Senate advanced bipartisan stablecoin legislation supported by the crypto industry and President Donald Trump, with final passage of the measure likely next week.
title: Crypto Industry-Backed Stablecoin Bill Advances in US Senate

author: Bob Van Voris, Madlin Mekelburg
description: The US Justice Department urged a federal judge not to interfere with the Trump administration’s deployment of the National Guard and US Marines to respond to deportation protests in Los Angeles.
title: US Urges Court Not to Limit Trump’s Use of Troops in LA

author: Nacha Cattan, Laura Nahmias
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams endorsed local legislation that would ease the path for Bally’s Corp. to build a casino in the Bronx.
title: NYC Mayor Gives Boost to Bally’s Casino Ahead of Council Vote

author: Jarrell Dillard
description: US customs duties climbed to a record in May, helping shrink the budget deficit for the month, while doubts remain about the persistence of the inflows as the Trump administration negotiates with trading partners and faces a judicial challenge over its levies.
title: US Tariff Revenue Hits Fresh Record, Helping Shrink May Deficit

author: Jenny Leonard, Mackenzie Hawkins
description: Trade talks between the US and China this week cemented a seismic change in Washington’s approach to the countries’ economic relationship: US export curbs, meant to keep sensitive technologies out of Beijing’s hands, are now explicitly up for negotiation.
title: US Makes Export Controls Negotiable as Part of China Trade Talks

author: Brendan Case
description: The Fulbright Foreign Scholarship Board resigned en masse to protest what it called unprecedented interference after the Trump administration denied a significant number of US academics from receiving the prestigious awards.
title: Fulbright Board Quits, Saying Trump Aides Blocked Scholarships

author: Tom Rees, Alex Wickham, Philip Aldrick
description: Rachel Reeves will pump billions of pounds into areas outside London as the Labour government tries to head off an electoral threat posed by Nigel Farage’s Reform UK.
title: Labour Gambles on Growth Boost Outside London to Beat Farage

author: Roxana Tiron, Ryan Chua, Julie Johnsson
description: The US and Qatar have yet to sign a memorandum of understanding for a luxury jumbo jet gifted by the Gulf country that President Donald Trump wants for Air Force One, his top defense chief told senators on Wednesday.
title: Deal for Trump’s Qatar Gift Jet Hasn’t Been Signed, Hegseth Says

author: Todd Gillespie, Janet Lorin
description: The US Treasury Department is considering changing rules to revoke tax-exempt status for colleges that consider race in student admissions, scholarships and other areas — potentially threatening the financial stability of hundreds of institutions.
title: Treasury Takes Aim at Hundreds of Colleges’ Tax-Exempt Status Over Race

author: Mathieu Dion
description: Canadian Industry Minister Melanie Joly said the government will soon announce measures to clamp down on steel dumping from foreign countries and help domestic manufacturers hit by punishing US tariffs.
title: Canada Eyeing Further Moves to Counter Foreign Steel Dumping

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union has proposed sanctioning two small Chinese banks for helping Russia get around the bloc’s existing trade restrictions, according to documents seen by Bloomberg.
title: EU Proposes Sanctioning Two Small Chinese Banks for Russia Trade

author: Erik Wasson
description: Senate Republicans are planning to water down House legislation that would shift as much as a quarter of the cost of federal food stamps to state governments to help pay for Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending package, a key senator said Wednesday.
title: Senate GOP Clashes With House on Food Aid Cuts in Trump Tax Bill

author: Marton Kasnyik
description: Hungary plans to sell company holdings belonging to its state defense industry conglomerate to a unit of telecommunications group 4iG Nyrt, according to statements from the company and the Economy Ministry.
title: Hungary to Privatize Defense Assets in Win for Orban-Backed Firm

author: Daniele Lepido
description: Italy is delaying a decision on whether Pirelli & C. SpA’s largest investor, state-backed Sinochem International Corp., breached rules designed to limit China’s influence over the tire manufacturer.
title: Italy Delays Decision on Probe Into Chinese Influence at Pirelli

author: Greg Ryan
description: Harvard University isn’t considering opening a foreign campus to counteract President Donald Trump’s push to block the enrollment of international students, despite an invitation from a top German culture official.
title: Harvard Spurns Overseas Campus as Antidote to Trump’s Ban on Foreign Students

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Europe will reiterate its commitment to back Ukraine and sanction Russia, as the US delays a decision over increasing pressure on Moscow to get President Vladimir Putin to the negotiating table.
title: Europe Set to Reaffirm Plan to Pressure Russia Despite US Delays

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said the European Union is likely to be among the last deals that the US completes, as the administration rushes to secure tariff agreements with other trading partners.
title: EU Likely to Be at ‘Very End’ of US Trade Deals, Lutnick Says

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: New York Attorney General Letitia James joined California in condemning the Trump administration for deploying troops from the state’s National Guard to respond to immigration protests in Los Angeles.
title: New York Joins California in Opposing Trump Using Troops in LA

author: Augusta Saraiva
description: For all the hand-wringing about tariffs, Americans are so far experiencing limited inflation from President Donald Trump’s protectionist trade policy.
title: US Clothes, Toy Prices Show Tariff Impact Only at Margins So Far

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: Boeing Co.’s new Air Force One faces several issues including unresolved technical modifications that could further delay delivery, congressional auditors found.
title: Air Force One Production Still Marred by Assembly Woes, GAO Says

author: Jorge Valero, Max Ramsay
description: The European Union reached a political agreement with the UK on the post-Brexit border arrangements for Gibraltar following talks on Wednesday in Brussels.
title: EU and UK Reach Deal on Gibraltar’s Post-Brexit Border Controls

author: Irina Anghel
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves laid out how she’ll divide more than £600 billion ($810 billion) of annual spending between departments, capping Labour’s first year in power. The decisions will have a broad impact across the UK, where the outlays account for about a fifth of the economy.
title: Here Are the Winners and Losers of UK’s Big Spending Shake-Up

author: Erik Wasson, Jaewon Kang
description: Walmart US CEO John Furner will address a gathering of House Republicans in the Capitol on Wednesday, hours after President Donald Trump announced a trade framework with China has been completed.
title: Walmart US CEO Furner to Address Largest House GOP Caucus

author: Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Poland’s Prime Minister Donald Tusk won a vote of confidence in parliament on Wednesday after he promised to reshuffle the government in the wake of a bruising defeat of his ally in a presidential election.
title: Polish Premier Tusk Wins Confidence Vote After Election Loss

author: Enda Curran
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent credited President Donald Trump’s policies for a slowdown in US inflation, and said he had challenged a “decades-old status quo” on trade.
title: Bessent Credits Trump Policies for ‘Substantial’ CPI Improvement

author: Marton Eder, Ugur Yilmaz, Firat Kozok, Daniel Hornak
description: Western banks including Raiffeisen Bank International AG that still operate units in Russia are helping some of the last European buyers of Russian pipeline gas pay for purchases after the US sanctioned Gazprombank.
title: European Banks With Russian Units Help Keep Natural Gas Flowing

author: Julie Fine
description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott vowed to use National Guard troops if needed to maintain order during protests against President Donald Trump this weekend.
title: Texas Governor Readies National Guard Troops Ahead of Protests

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent during a House Appropriations Subcommittee hearing in Washington on May 6. Photographer: Tierney L. Cross/Bloomberg
title: Bessent to Face Questions on Tariffs, Tax Bill in House Hearing

author: Arsalan Shahla
description: Tensions in the US-Iran nuclear talks came to the fore as President Donald Trump voiced skepticism about an agreement, while Tehran raised the prospect of attacks on American bases.
title: US-Iran Strains Show and Oil Rises as Trump Says He’s ‘Less Confident’ on Nuclear Deal

author: Josh Wingrove, Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said a trade framework with China has been completed, with Beijing supplying rare earths and magnets “UP FRONT” and the US allowing Chinese students into its colleges and universities.
title: Trump Says China Will Ship Rare Earths in ‘Done’ Trade Deal

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: Gold is winning over the hearts of Argentines, a nation once almost irrationally devoted to the dollar.
title: Dollar-Obsessed Argentines Have a Newfound Love for Buying Gold

author: Gresa Kraja
description: Kosovo is willing to temporarily host migrants deported from the US, the government in Pristina said, as US President Donald Trump’s administration searches for countries to take in third-country deportees.
title: Kosovo Willing to Take In Third-Country Deportees from US

author: Daniel Hornak
description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico threatened to block the European Union’s new sanctions package against the Kremlin unless the bloc comes up with a way to address the potential loss of Russian energy supplies.
title: Slovak Premier Threatens to Block EU Sanctions Against Russia

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: Rising geopolitical tensions and shifts in trade policy have increased risks to Ireland’s financial system, the country’s regulator warned.
title: Trade War Adds Risk to Irish Financial System, Regulator Warns

author: Zahra Hirji
description: FEMA recently told Iowa, Mississippi, Missouri and Oklahoma it won’t be granting funds to bolster state defenses against future natural disasters.
title: The Trump Administration Keeps Denying Disaster Preparedness Aid to States

author: Martin Ritchie, Alberto Nardelli, Laura Curtis
description: For months Donald Trump pushed tariffs and trade restrictions on China to unprecedented levels, part of a strategy to force Xi Jinping into talks the US president expected would help cut the trade deficit and boost American manufacturing.
title: China Found World’s Pain Point on Trade — and Will Use It Again

author: Galit Altstein
description: Israel’s center- and left-wing opposition said it’s submitting a bill to dissolve parliament and won the support of two ultra-Orthodox parties in Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government, opening up the prospect of early elections if the legislation makes it through four rounds of voting.
title: Israeli Lawmakers to Vote on Early Election in Blow to Netanyahu

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italy faces a tricky global backdrop but is still well positioned to achieve its economic growth target for this year if not even to beat it, according to the country’s finance minister.
title: Italy Can Achieve or Even Beat GDP Goal for 2025, Giorgetti Says

author: Firat Kozok, Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Turkey will sell 48 fighter jets to Indonesia in the coming decade, according to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, as Ankara pushes to build its defense industry and increase exports of military hardware.
title: Erdogan Says Indonesia to Buy Nearly 50 Fighter Jets from Turkey

author: Ailbhe Rea
description: Keir Starmer’s former chief of staff, Sue Gray, will join global advisory firm Consello Group as its UK chair, moving into business 8 months after her departure from the prime minister’s top team.
title: Former Top Starmer Aide Sue Gray to Join Advisory Firm Consello

author: Patricia Hurtado, David Voreacos, Anika Arora Seth
description: Donald Trump’s lawyers will be back in court Wednesday to renew their push to dismiss the New York jury verdict that makes him the only person convicted of a felony to serve as president.
title: Trump Seeks Quick Path to Supreme Court in Hush Money Appeal

author: Kate Sullivan
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump’s LA Crackdown Risks Global Fallout

author: Colum Murphy
description: China cheered a new framework to defuse trade tensions with the US after two days of intense negotiation, calling on both countries to adhere to the agreement and maintain dialogue to stabilize ties.
title: China Urges US to Comply With ‘Hard-Won’ Deal After London Talks

author: John Ainger, Ewa Krukowska
description: The European Union is close to agreeing on more flexibility to achieve gas storage targets ahead of winter following fears that the current goal has contributed to market speculation.
title: EU Hones In on Flexible Rules to Fill Gas Storage Before Winter

author: Jorge Valero, Andrea Palasciano
description: The European Union’s lending arm will partner with large European lenders including Deutsche Bank AG to provide €3 billion ($3.4 billion) in funding for defense, overcoming reluctance in the sector to participate in the region’s rearmament.
title: EIB to Channel Defense Funding Via Deutsche Bank to Push Lending

author: Levin Stamm
description: Switzerland’s senate approved proposals to loosen strict controls on exports of war materials, a move that could help its increasingly isolated defense industry.
title: Swiss Senate Eases Arms Export Rules Amid Industry Struggles

author: Amy Stillman, Maya Averbuch
description: Mexico’s government has pledged to provide jobs for citizens deported from the US, but recent data shows that barely 4% of the tens of thousands expelled since late January have been matched with employment.
title: Mexico’s Pledge to Give Deportees Jobs Hits Snag Over US Flights

author: Henry Meyer
description: Russia proposed transferring Iran’s excess nuclear material to its territory as part of efforts to assist Iran and the US in reaching an agreement over the Islamic Republic’s atomic program, Interfax reported.
title: Russia Makes Iran Nuclear Offer for US Pact, Interfax Says

author: Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said he’d reshuffle his government in July, defending his record in power as he sought to rally his ruling coalition ahead of a confidence vote in parliament.
title: Poland’s Tusk Flags Government Reshuffle Before Confidence Vote

author: William Selway
description: Elon Musk, who served as a close adviser and confidante to President Donald Trump until a bitter public falling out last week in a series of social-media posts, issued his strongest sign of contrition yet over how he handled the rupture.
title: Musk Says He Regrets Social Media Posts Lashing Out at Trump

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero
description: The European Union believes trade negotiations with the US could extend beyond President Donald Trump’s July 9 deadline, even as the speed of the talks has increased over the past week.
title: EU Aims for US Trade Talks to Extend Past Trump’s July Deadline

author: Charlie Duxbury
description: Swedes’ enthusiasm to adopt the euro fell for the first time in four and a half years after a recent run of strength for the krona, a survey showed.
title: Swedish Support for Joining Euro Fades as Krona Strengthens

author: Ben Westcott
description: The European Union is ready and willing to make a second attempt at securing a free trade deal with Australia, EU Ambassador Gabriele Visentin said, while adding that the main obstacles to an accord that were identified in 2023 are largely unchanged.
title: EU Ready for Second Attempt at Australia Trade Deal, Envoy Says

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korea appears to have constructed a new building within its main nuclear complex, satellite imagery showed, in what could be an additional enrichment facility to ramp up the country’s ability to produce nuclear weapons.
title: North Korea Appears to Have Added to Its Nuclear Complex

author: Roxana Tiron, Anthony Capaccio
description: The Air Force has cut in half its request to Congress for its signature F-35s, dealing a blow to Lockheed Martin Corp., the top US defense contractor.
title: Pentagon Slashes in Half Its Request for Air Force F-35s

author: Manuela Tobias
description: Argentina’s top court sidelined former President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner from elections, likely ushering in a new political era in South America’s second biggest economy.
title: Kirchner’s Ban From Office Marks New Chapter for Argentina

author: Zoe Schneeweiss
description: There’s no longer-term advantage to being a bully on global commerce, according to European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde.
title: Being a Bully on Trade Won’t Work Longer Term, Lagarde Warns

author: Anisah Shukry
description: After more than two years of relative political stability in Malaysia, Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim faces multiple hurdles that could fuel discontent within his ruling coalition.
title: Malaysia’s Anwar Faces More Challenges Even as Lawsuit Paused

author: Eliyahu Kamisher
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom accused President Donald Trump of misusing his power by mobilizing troops in Los Angeles and warned other states to prepare for similar unrest, as protests over immigration raids stretched into a fifth night and led to a curfew in parts of the city’s downtown.
title: Downtown LA Under Curfew as Newsom Warns of Trump’s Overreach

author: John Liu, Lin Zhu, Winnie Hsu
description: Chinese stocks rose on Wednesday, after the world’s two largest economies agreed to de-escalate trade tensions following a two-day meeting in London.
title: Chinese Stocks Gain as Trade Tensions With US De-Escalate

author: Isabela Fleischmann
description: National Guard troops are now protecting Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers in and around Los Angeles, marking an expansion of their duties since being deployed by President Donald Trump this week.
title: National Guard Providing Security for ICE Officers, US Says

author: Nacha Cattan, Sri Taylor
description: New Jersey voters have chosen Mikie Sherrill to face off against Jack Ciattarelli, pitting a moderate Democrat against a Trump-endorsed Republican in the first gubernatorial election since last year’s presidential race.
title: NJ’s Sherrill, Ciattarelli Win Primaries in Governor’s Race

author: Winnie Hsu, Marcus Wong
description: Asia’s traders mostly shrugged off news of a preliminary US-China trade deal, with most looking for more details from the accord before making investment plans.
title: Asian Markets Await More Details on US-China Trade Talk Progress

author: Zoe Tillman, Erik Larson
description: Donald Trump can continue to enforce his global tariffs for now, a federal appeals court held in a win for the president on one of his signature economic policies.
title: Trump Tariffs Can Remain in Effect, US Appeals Court Says
